[vc_column_text]If you are planning to and are not sure what documents would you need from your employer, then you are in right place.

Skilled workers applying for immigration through one of the British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program Skills Immigration categories will need to obtain many documents from their Canadian employer and submit them with their application.

Here is a list of the main BC PNP employer documents required.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Employer Declaration Form” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The BC PNP Employer Declaration form or BC PNP Employer Job Offer form includes vital details about the employer, company/organization, job position, and recruitment efforts.

A company contact with authority must complete and sign this document with consent from the company.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Recommendation Letter” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The BC PNP employer recommendation letter is a recommendation letter that outlines why the employer recommends the applicants for Canadian permanent residence, why they are suitable for the job position they are being hired for, and how they would contribute to the company’s operations. This letter should also include the recruitment efforts before hiring the applicant.

Learn more: BC PNP Employer Recommendation Letter with Sample[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” Signed Copy of the Job Offer Letter” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The employer must provide a signed copy of the original job offer letter they sent the applicant. This letter should mention key position details such as:

  • Main duties
  • Pay rate
  • Expected work hours
  • Discretionary benefits

The letter should pertain to a full-time position and be printed on official company letterhead.

Related Topic: 7 Practical Tips to Get Job Offer from Outside Canada[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Detailed Job Description” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The employer must provide a detailed description of the position they have offered the client. This includes specific duties and the requirements the applicant needs to possess to qualify for the job.

You may also like: Employer Reference Letter for Canada PR[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”5. Valid Copy of the Municipal Business License” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The employer must include a copy of a valid municipal business license pertaining to their business. This document demonstrates the employer’s organization has been licensed to operate in its municipality.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”6. Copy of the Certificate of Incorporation” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The employer must include a copy of the original certificate of incorporation or equivalent legal documents relating to Evidence of Recruitment Efforts” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]One of the most important BC PNP Documents required from an Employer is evidence of recruitment efforts. Most candidates do not submit properly and end up getting a refusal. The employer must describe the recruitment efforts they undertook before choosing to hire the applicant. This includes details such as:

  • Where they advertised the position
  • How long have they advertised the position for
  • Details of the Canadian permanent residents and citizens who applied for the position and were rejected
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Need Help?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]As you can see, numerous documents are required for BC PNP from employers inside British Columbia. Please contact Elaar Immigration to ensure you submit the correct documents with your BC PNP application. Our specialized team of Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultants is familiar with the documents required for each BC PNP program and can help your employer gather the correct ones.

excerpt.rendered: Applying for the BC PNP, but are unsure what documents your employer needs to provide? Here is a checklist of all the required BC PNP employer documents.
